intro: Monolophus wongsuwaniae, commonly known as the Thai mountain lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of northern Thailand. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
